channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pope Leo's religious community is drawing renewed interest. Here's what makes it unique
item.description: "Before, we might get two or three discerners. But after Pope Leo, I now have 15. It's unbelievable."

item.title: National Guard presence may deter crime, but crime experts warn of the long-term costs
item.description: As President Trump ramps up efforts to send federal officers and troops into cities, criminologists are watching closely. Are the feds doing this in a...

item.title: Israel intercepts aid flotilla headed for Gaza
item.description: As Israel intercepted the aid ships, an airstrike also killed at least one aid worker in Gaza.

item.title: AI designs for dangerous DNA can slip past biosecurity measures, study shows
item.description: Companies that make DNA for science labs screen out any requests for dangerous bits of genetic material. But a new study shows how AI could help malev...

item.title: The CDC still hasn't issued COVID vaccine guidelines, leaving access in limbo
item.description: Access to the COVID-19 vaccines remains difficult because of an unusual and unexplained delay by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention in acc...

item.title: Gateway Church founder Robert Morris pleads guilty in child sexual abuse case
item.description: The longtime Texas pastor admitted to indecent conduct with a child, resolving a decades-old case tied to allegations of abuse in Oklahoma.

item.title: 2 killed in terror attack outside synagogue in U.K.; attacker dead
item.description: The terror attack unfolded outside a synagogue in the English city of Manchester while worshippers were inside, authorities said.

item.title: Mixed Martial Arts: A New Kind of Fight | 60 Minutes Archive
item.description: In 2006, Scott Pelley reported on MMA, a form of hand-to-hand combat combining styles like boxing, wrestling and jiu-jitsu. Once banned, at the time i...

item.title: Trump uses government shutdown to dole out firings and political punishment
Eyewitnesses to Charlie Kirk's assassination call for civilized debate
item.description: Liberal Hunter Kozak asked Charlie Kirk's final question. Conservative Jeb Jacobi volunteers with Turning Point USA. Together, they say people who dis...

item.title: FDA approves another generic abortion pill, prompting outrage from conservatives
item.description: Federal health officials have approved another generic version of the abortion pill, prompting outrage from abortion opponents.

item.title: 'Find common ground', tourists in Washington tell lawmakers amid shutdown
item.description: Several museums and landmarks, including the US Capitol and Washington Monument, have closed to visitors.

item.title: Robert Mugabe's son appears in court on drug charge
item.description: Police allege they found marijuana on him during a traffic stop and are investigating a "syndicate linked to him".

item.title: Four ill with sepsis after food poisoning outbreak at Stockholm restaurant
item.description: The rare and potentially life-threatening complication comes after the people dined at a luxury eatery.

item.title: Captain of tanker linked to Russian 'shadow fleet' charged in France
item.description: The Chinese national faces a count of refusing to follow naval instructions while piloting the vessel.

item.title: Israel intercepts Gaza flotilla and detains activists including Greta Thunberg
item.description: South Africa and Turkey have criticised the incident in international waters. Israel says those on board are safe.

item.title: How the 2025 government shutdown could differ from previous ones
item.description: The Trump administration appears poised to use the government shutdown to accelerate federal workforce firings and end federal programs it dislikes. C...
